caption:
In the photograph, an older man and a young woman are interacting onboard a boat moored near a lake. The man, wearing a light khaki outfit and a park ranger-style hat, is handing a metal object, perhaps a tool or part of the boat, to the young woman. She is dressed in a red and purple patterned bikini, standing on one leg as she reaches out to take the item from the man.

The setting includes a clear blue sky and calm waters. In the background, there is a dock with sheltered areas that house more boats, suggesting this could be a marina or a private docking area. The boat itself appears well-equipped, with various controls and steering instruments visible in front of where the man is kneeling.

The overall mood is cooperative and educational, perhaps indicative of a learning scenario or a maintenance activity being guided by the older man. The lush greenery across the water and the peaceful environment complement the serene, outdoor setting commonly associated with lakeside activities.
title: Water patrol supervisor Dan Needham stops to refuel at Bikini Beach, a floating service station with a self-explanatory name. Attendant is Jill Phillips, a college student working summers.
placename: Ozarks, Lake of the, State Park (Mo.)
location: Ozarks, Lake of the, State Park, Missouri
